de.ailis.usb4java.jni

Class USB

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ailis.usb4java.jni.USB

  • public final class USB
extends Object
    This is the main class of the usb4java JNI wrapper. It wraps the global functions of libusb 0.x and defines all the constants. Usage is the same as documented by libusb. A common error is passing indirect buffers to the methods provided here. You always must use direct buffers which can be obtained by ByteBuffer.allocateDirect()
    Author:
    Klaus Reimer (k@ailis.de)

    • Method Detail

      • usb_init

        public static void usb_init()
        Initialize libusb. Just like the name implies, usb_init sets up some internal structures. usb_init must be called before any other libusb functions.

      • usb_find_busses

        public static int usb_find_busses()
        Finds all USB busses on system. usb_find_busses will find all of the busses on the system. Returns the number of changes since previous call to this function (total of new busses and busses removed).
        Returns:
        The number of changes since previous call.

      • usb_find_devices

        public static int usb_find_devices()
        Find all devices on all USB devices. usb_find_devices will find all of the devices on each bus. This should be called after usb_find_busses. Returns the number of changes since the previous call to this function (total of new device and devices removed).
        Returns:
        The number of changes since previous call.

      • usb_get_busses

        public static USB_Bus usb_get_busses()
        Return the list of USB busses found. usb_get_busses simply returns the value of the global variable usb_busses. This was implemented for those languages that support C calling convention and can use shared libraries, but don't support C global variables (like Delphi).
        Returns:
        The list of USB busses found.

      • usb_open

        public static USB_Dev_Handle usb_open(USB_Device device)
        Opens a USB device. usb_open is to be used to open up a device for use. usb_open must be called before attempting to perform any operations to the device. Returns a handle used in future communication with the device.
        Parameters:
        device - The USB device.
        Returns:
        The USB device handle.

      • usb_close

        public static int usb_close(USB_Dev_Handle handle)
        Closes a USB device. usb_close closes a device opened with usb_open. No further operations may be performed on the handle after usb_close is called. Returns 0 on success or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        Returns:
        0 on success or < 0 on error.

      • usb_set_configuration

        public static int usb_set_configuration(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                        int configuration)
        Sets the active configuration of a device. usb_set_configuration sets the active configuration of a device. The configuration parameter is the value as specified in the descriptor field bConfigurationValue. Returns 0 on success or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        configuration - The configuration to activate.
        Returns:
        0 on success or < 0 on error.

      • usb_set_altinterface

        public static int usb_set_altinterface(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                       int alternate)
        Sets the active alternate setting of the current interface Description. usb_set_altinterface sets the active alternate setting of the current interface. The alternate parameter is the value as specified in the descriptor field bAlternateSetting. Returns 0 on success or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        alternate - The alternate setting to activate.
        Returns:
        0 on success or < 0 on error.

      • usb_clear_halt

        public static int usb_clear_halt(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                 int ep)
        Clears any halt status on an endpoint. usb_clear_halt clears any halt status on the specified endpoint. The ep parameter is the value specified in the descriptor field bEndpointAddress. Returns 0 on success or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        ep - The endpoint.
        Returns:
        0 on success or < 0 on error.

      • usb_reset

        public static int usb_reset(USB_Dev_Handle handle)
        Resets a device. usb_reset resets the specified device by sending a RESET down the port it is connected to. Returns 0 on success or < 0 on error. Causes re-enumeration: After calling usb_reset, the device will need to re-enumerate and thusly, requires you to find the new device and open a new handle. The handle used to call usb_reset will no longer work.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        Returns:
        0 on success or < 0 on error.

      • usb_claim_interface

        public static int usb_claim_interface(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                      int iface)
        Claim an interface of a device. usb_claim_interface claims the interface with the Operating System. The interface parameter is the value as specified in the descriptor field bInterfaceNumber. Returns 0 on success or < 0 on error. Must be called!: usb_claim_interface must be called before you perform any operations related to this interface (like usb_set_altinterface, usb_bulk_write, etc).
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        iface - The interface to claim.
        Returns:
        0 on success or < 0 on error.

      • usb_release_interface

        public static int usb_release_interface(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                        int iface)
        Releases a previously claimed interface. usb_release_interface releases an interface previously claimed with usb_claim_interface. The interface parameter is the value as specified in the descriptor field bInterfaceNumber. Returns 0 on success or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        iface - The interface to release.
        Returns:
        0 on success or < 0 on error.

      • usb_control_msg

        public static int usb_control_msg(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                  int requesttype,
                  int request,
                  int value,
                  int index,
                  ByteBuffer bytes,
                  int timeout)
        Send a control message to a device. usb_control_msg performs a control request to the default control pipe on a device. The parameters mirror the types of the same name in the USB specification. Returns number of bytes written/read or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The device handle.
        requesttype - The request type (unsigned byte).
        • Bit 7: Data transfer direction (0=Host-to-device, 1=Device-to-host). See USB_ENDPOINT_IN and USB_ENDPOINT_OUT constants.
        • Bit 6-5: Type (0=Standard, 1=Class, 2=Vendor, 3=Reserved). See USB_TYPE_* constants.
        • Bit 4-0: Recipient (0=Device, 1=Interface, 2=Endpoint, 3=Other, 4-31=Reserved. See USB_RECIP_* constants.
        request - The specific request (unsigned byte). See USB_REQ_* constants for some standard requests.
        value - The value (unsigned short).
        index - The index or offset (unsigned short).
        bytes - The bytes to transfer. This must be a direct buffer obtained for example by ByteBuffer.allocateDirect().
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written/read or < 0 on error.

      • usb_get_string

        public static int usb_get_string(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                 int index,
                 int langid,
                 ByteBuffer buffer)
        Retrieves a string descriptor from a device. usb_get_string retrieves the string descriptor specified by index and langid from a device. The string will be returned in Unicode as specified by the USB specification. Returns the number of bytes returned in buf or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        index - The string description index.
        langid - The language id.
        buffer - The buffer to write the string to. This must be a direct buffer obtained for example by ByteBuffer.allocateDirect().
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read or < 0 on error.

      • usb_get_string

        public static USB_String_Descriptor usb_get_string(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                                   int index,
                                   int langid,
                                   int size)
        Returns a string descriptor from a device.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        index - The string description index.
        langid - The language id.
        size - The maximum number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        The string descriptor or null if an error occurred.

      • usb_get_string

        public static USB_String_Descriptor usb_get_string(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                                   int index,
                                   int langid)
        Returns a string descriptor from a device.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        index - The string description index.
        langid - The language id.
        Returns:
        The string descriptor or null if an error occurred.

      • usb_get_string_simple

        public static int usb_get_string_simple(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                        int index,
                        ByteBuffer buffer)
        Retrieves a string descriptor from a device using the first language. usb_get_string_simple is a wrapper around usb_get_string that retrieves the string description specified by index in the first language for the descriptor and converts it into C style ASCII. Returns number of bytes returned in buf or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        index - The string description index.
        buffer - The buffer to write the string to. This must be a direct buffer obtained for example by ByteBuffer.allocateDirect().
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read or < 0 on error.

      • usb_get_string_simple

        public static String usb_get_string_simple(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                           int index,
                           int size)
        Returns a string descriptor from a device using the first language. Unlike the native usb_get_string_simple() function this method returns the string in correct unicode encoding.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        index - The string description index.
        size - The maximum number of characters to read.
        Returns:
        The string or null if an error occurred.

      • usb_get_string_simple

        public static String usb_get_string_simple(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                           int index)
        Returns a string descriptor from a device using the first language. Unlike the native usb_get_string_simple() function this method returns the string in correct unicode encoding.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        index - The string description index.
        Returns:
        The string or null if an error occurred.

      • usb_get_languages

        public static short[] usb_get_languages(USB_Dev_Handle handle)
        Returns the languages the specified device supports.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        Returns:
        Array with supported language codes.

      • usb_get_descriptor

        public static int usb_get_descriptor(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                     int type,
                     int index,
                     ByteBuffer buffer)
        Retrieves a descriptor from a device's default control pipe. usb_get_descriptor retrieves a descriptor from the device identified by the type and index of the descriptor from the default control pipe. Returns number of bytes read for the descriptor or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The device handle.
        type - The descriptor type.
        index - The descriptor index.
        buffer - The buffer to put the read bytes in. This must be a direct buffer obtained for example by ByteBuffer.allocateDirect().
        Returns:
        Number of bytes read or < 0 on error.

      • usb_get_descriptor_by_endpoint

        public static int usb_get_descriptor_by_endpoint(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                                 int ep,
                                 int type,
                                 int index,
                                 ByteBuffer buffer)
        Retrieves a descriptor from a device. usb_get_descriptor_by_endpoint retrieves a descriptor from the device identified by the type and index of the descriptor from the control pipe identified by ep. Returns number of bytes read for the descriptor or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The device handle.
        ep - The endpoint.
        type - The descriptor type.
        index - The descriptor index.
        buffer - The buffer to put the read bytes in. This must be a direct buffer obtained for example by ByteBuffer.allocateDirect().
        Returns:
        Number of bytes read or < 0 on error.

      • usb_bulk_write

        public static int usb_bulk_write(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                 int ep,
                 ByteBuffer bytes,
                 int timeout)
        Write data to a bulk endpoint. usb_bulk_write performs a bulk write request to the endpoint specified by ep. Returns number of bytes written on success or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The device handle.
        ep - The endpoint.
        bytes - The bytes to write. This must be a direct buffer obtained for example by ByteBuffer.allocateDirect().
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        Bytes written on success or < 0 on error.

      • usb_bulk_read

        public static int usb_bulk_read(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                int ep,
                ByteBuffer bytes,
                int timeout)
        Read data from a bulk endpoint. usb_bulk_read performs a bulk read request to the endpoint specified by ep. Returns number of bytes read on success or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The device handle.
        ep - The endpoint.
        bytes - The read bytes. This must be a direct buffer obtained for example by ByteBuffer.allocateDirect().
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        Bytes read on success or < 0 on error.

      • usb_interrupt_write

        public static int usb_interrupt_write(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                      int ep,
                      ByteBuffer bytes,
                      int timeout)
        Write data to an interrupt endpoint. usb_interrupt_write performs an interrupt write request to the endpoint specified by ep. Returns number of bytes written on success or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The device handle.
        ep - The endpoint.
        bytes - The bytes to write.
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        Bytes written on success or < 0 on error.

      • usb_interrupt_read

        public static int usb_interrupt_read(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                     int ep,
                     ByteBuffer bytes,
                     int timeout)
        Read data from an interrupt endpoint. usb_interrupt_read performs a interrupt read request to the endpoint specified by ep. Returns number of bytes read on success or < 0 on error.
        Parameters:
        handle - The device handle.
        ep - The endpoint.
        bytes - The read bytes. This must be a direct buffer obtained for example by ByteBuffer.allocateDirect().
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        Bytes read on success or < 0 on error.

      • usb_strerror

        public static String usb_strerror()
        Returns the last error message.
        Returns:
        The last error message.

      • usb_get_driver_np

        public static int usb_get_driver_np(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                    int iface,
                    ByteBuffer buffer)
        Get driver name bound to interface. This function will obtain the name of the driver bound to the interface specified by the parameter interface and place it into the specified buffer. Returns 0 on success or < 0 on error. Implemented on Linux only. On other platforms an UnsatisfiedLinkError exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        iface - The interface number.
        buffer - The buffer to place the name in. This must be a direct buffer obtained for example by ByteBuffer.allocateDirect().
        Returns:
        0 on success or < 0 on error.

      • usb_get_driver_np

        public static String usb_get_driver_np(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                       int iface)
        Get driver name bound to interface. This function will obtain the name of the driver bound to the interface specified by the parameter interface. Implemented on Linux only. On other platforms an UnsatisfiedLinkError exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        handle - The USB device handle.
        iface - The interface number.
        Returns:
        The driver name or null on error.

      • usb_detach_kernel_driver_np

        public static int usb_detach_kernel_driver_np(USB_Dev_Handle handle,
                              int iface)
        Detach kernel driver from interface. This function will detach a kernel driver from the interface specified by parameter interface. Applications using libusb can then try claiming the interface. Returns 0 on success or < 0 on error. Implemented on Linux only. On other platforms an UnsatisfiedLinkError exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        handle - The device handle.
        iface - The interface number.
        Returns:
        0 on success or < 0 on error.

      • libusb_has_get_driver_np

        public static boolean libusb_has_get_driver_np()
        Checks if libusb supports the usb_get_driver_np function.
        Returns:
        True if support is present, false if not.

      • libusb_has_detach_kernel_driver_np

        public static boolean libusb_has_detach_kernel_driver_np()
        Checks if libusb supports the usb_detach_kernel_driver_np function.
        Returns:
        True if support is present, false if not.
